title: Step 1 - Create a New Stocktake (Full)
text: Step 1: Select "Create New." This will open a new page. Step 2: Provide a suitable description for the Stocktake. Step 3: From the stocktake type drop-down, select "Full." Step 4: Choose a shop from the shop drop-down. Step 5: Click "Save" to create your new Full stocktake. Step 6: Wait for a few moments. Afterward, you will be redirected to the newly created Stocktake form. Step 7: Start counting your stock from this page.
description:
Step 1: Select "Create New." This will open a new page.




Step 2: Provide a suitable description for the Stocktake.


Step 3: From the stocktake type drop-down, select "Full."


Step 4: Choose a shop from the shop drop-down.


Step 5: Click "Save" to create your new Full stocktake.




Step 6: Wait for a few moments. Afterward, you will be redirected to the newly created Stocktake form.


Step 7: Start counting your stock from this page.

title: Step 2 - Count Add Items to Stocktake
text: Step 1: Select "Count." This opens a counting page where you can manually add items or import a count from a file. (For file import, refer to the separate section on File Import.) Step 2: Enter the Physical Section You Are Currently Counting. You can choose to add your counts in individual sections, such as Stockroom, gondolas/stands, display windows, cupboards, etc. This allows you to break down the count according to your shop's structure. If you are importing, the sections may be defined by the import file. You can select and modify individual count lists later before completing the stocktake. If left blank, all counts will be listed under the Default section in the Count drop-down list. Step 3: Enter the Barcode. You can scan or manually enter a barcode into the barcode box to search for an item. When selected, a default quantity of 1 is added. Step 4: Use Find Item Manually. You can search for an item manually using various options: Search Text: Find the item based on a whole word or use " before or after the word to search for all possibilities (e.g., "can" for candles or "*proof" for waterproof). Vendor: Use the drop-down to select one or more vendors from the list. Item Groups: Use the drop-down to select one or more item groups from the list. Search: Initiate the search process and display all results in the list below. Note: The steps mentioned above are part of the process when you are on the counting page, allowing you to add items manually or search for items using barcodes or manual search options.
description:
Step 1: Select "Count." This opens a counting page where you can manually add items or import a count from a file. (For file import, refer to the separate section on File Import.)




Step 2: Enter the Physical Section You Are Currently Counting. You can choose to add your counts in individual sections, such as Stockroom, gondolas/stands, display windows, cupboards, etc. This allows you to break down the count according to your shop's structure. If you are importing, the sections may be defined by the import file. You can select and modify individual count lists later before completing the stocktake. If left blank, all counts will be listed under the Default section in the Count drop-down list.


Step 3: Enter the Barcode. You can scan or manually enter a barcode into the barcode box to search for an item. When selected, a default quantity of 1 is added.


Step 4: Use Find Item Manually. You can search for an item manually using various options:

Search Text: Find the item based on a whole word or use " before or after the word to search for all possibilities (e.g., "can" for candles or "*proof" for waterproof).

Vendor: Use the drop-down to select one or more vendors from the list.

Item Groups: Use the drop-down to select one or more item groups from the list.

Search: Initiate the search process and display all results in the list below.

Note: The steps mentioned above are part of the process when you are on the counting page, allowing you to add items manually or search for items using barcodes or manual search options.

title: Step 3 - Manual Count
text: Step 1: If you are counting by sections, enter a description in the physical section box. Step 2: Scan or key in a barcode or use the Find Item Manually option to alter count quantities. Each scan of the barcode increases the quantity by 1. The most recent scanned item is displayed in the Last Scanned item box. You can manually adjust the quantity here instead of in the Manual Count list before moving to the next item. Step 3: If adding items directly from the item list, adjust count quantities using the Plus and Minus buttons or by selecting the quantity field. The quantity is limited to a maximum value of 10 digits (e.g., 9999999999) with up to 2 decimal places (e.g., 99999999.99). The minimum value is 0. Step 4: Use the items by page [5 10 20 50 100] and the page number [1 of 3362 (3362 items)] to scroll through and find more items. Step 5: When all counts are added, choose the Back button to close the count page. All counts are automatically saved. If you entered a description into the Physical section box, it will appear in the Count list. Use the drop-down to see all Counts. Step 6: To add more individual counts, choose Count again from the top right-hand side and add a different physical description. Step 7: To amend a specific location, such as Location 55, choose Count again from the top right-hand side and type in the same description again. It MUST be the same description; otherwise, it will show under a new count location. Step 8: Repeat the Count process until all items to be counted are added.
description:
Step 1: If you are counting by sections, enter a description in the physical section box.


Step 2: Scan or key in a barcode or use the Find Item Manually option to alter count quantities. Each scan of the barcode increases the quantity by 1. The most recent scanned item is displayed in the Last Scanned item box. You can manually adjust the quantity here instead of in the Manual Count list before moving to the next item.


Step 3: If adding items directly from the item list, adjust count quantities using the Plus and Minus buttons or by selecting the quantity field. The quantity is limited to a maximum value of 10 digits (e.g., 9999999999) with up to 2 decimal places (e.g., 99999999.99). The minimum value is 0.



Step 4: Use the items by page [5 10 20 50 100] and the page number [1 of 3362 (3362 items)] to scroll through and find more items.




Step 5: When all counts are added, choose the Back button to close the count page. All counts are automatically saved. If you entered a description into the Physical section box, it will appear in the Count list. Use the drop-down to see all Counts.


Step 6: To add more individual counts, choose Count again from the top right-hand side and add a different physical description.


Step 7: To amend a specific location, such as Location 55, choose Count again from the top right-hand side and type in the same description again. It MUST be the same description; otherwise, it will show under a new count location.





Step 8: Repeat the Count process until all items to be counted are added.

title: Step 4 - Calculate / Recount
text: Step 1: From the Count screen, choose "Calculate." Step 2: Wait for the calculation process to complete. It may take some time, especially for a full stock calculation. Avoid changing stock quantities while the calculation is in progress. Once finished, the status will change to "Calculated." Step 3: Click on a calculated stocktake to view the results. Step 4: In the header section, you'll see a summary of the calculation, including Expected, Counted, and Variance for Quantity, Cost, and Price. The item list provides more detailed quantity figures. Step 5: Review the discrepancy report to identify any differences between the counted and expected figures. The report can be sorted from highest to lowest or vice versa for easier identification. By default, only items with discrepancies are shown. To view all items, including those without discrepancies, toggle the option off. Step 6: If needed, export the Discrepancy list to Excel using the XLSX button. Step 7: If you need to make changes and adjust quantities, choose "Recount." Step 8: Confirm the recount by selecting "Yes." Choosing "No" or "Cancel" will cancel the recount request. Step 9: The system will take you back to the counting section, where you can adjust quantities as required. Once done, choose "Calculate" again. Step 10: You can repeat the recount process as many times as needed until you are ready to commit the final counts. × Close
description:
Step 1: From the Count screen, choose "Calculate."




Step 2: Wait for the calculation process to complete. It may take some time, especially for a full stock calculation. Avoid changing stock quantities while the calculation is in progress. Once finished, the status will change to "Calculated."




Step 3: Click on a calculated stocktake to view the results.



Step 4: In the header section, you'll see a summary of the calculation, including Expected, Counted, and Variance for Quantity, Cost, and Price. The item list provides more detailed quantity figures.


Step 5: Review the discrepancy report to identify any differences between the counted and expected figures. The report can be sorted from highest to lowest or vice versa for easier identification. By default, only items with discrepancies are shown. To view all items, including those without discrepancies, toggle the option off.


Step 6: If needed, export the Discrepancy list to Excel using the XLSX button.



Step 7: If you need to make changes and adjust quantities, choose "Recount."


Step 8: Confirm the recount by selecting "Yes." Choosing "No" or "Cancel" will cancel the recount request.




Step 9: The system will take you back to the counting section, where you can adjust quantities as required. Once done, choose "Calculate" again.


Step 10: You can repeat the recount process as many times as needed until you are ready to commit the final counts.

×
Close

title: Step 5 - Commit
text: Step 1: Review the discrepancy report. Step 2: If everything is correct, choose "Commit" to accept the discrepancy report and update the stock figures. Step 3: A prompt will appear asking you to confirm the commitment. Select "Yes, Commit" to proceed with the Commit request. Step 4: The stocktake list will show "Committing" while making the final adjustments. Once completed, it will show "Closed." Step 5: You can view the closed stocktake again by clicking on the closed stocktake in the list. Note: The steps mentioned above involve accepting the discrepancy report and updating the stock figures by committing the changes.
description:
Step 1: Review the discrepancy report.


Step 2: If everything is correct, choose "Commit" to accept the discrepancy report and update the stock figures.


 

Step 3: A prompt will appear asking you to confirm the commitment. Select "Yes, Commit" to proceed with the Commit request.


 


Step 4: The stocktake list will show "Committing" while making the final adjustments. Once completed, it will show "Closed."




Step 5: You can view the closed stocktake again by clicking on the closed stocktake in the list.




Note: The steps mentioned above involve accepting the discrepancy report and updating the stock figures by committing the changes.
